headline: Would a Paramount Skydance bid for Warner Bros. be a good deal?
summary: Media giant Paramount Skydance (PSKY) is putting together a bid to buy Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), according to recent reports from the Wall Street Journal. Bloomberg Intelligence senior media analyst Geetha Ranganathan breaks down what a deal could mean for Paramount Skydance in the broader media landscape. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Media giant Paramount Skydance (PSKY) is putting together a bid to buy Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), according to recent reports from the Wall Street Journal.

Bloomberg Intelligence senior media analyst Geetha Ranganathan breaks down what a deal could mean for Paramount Skydance in the broader media landscape.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.summary: Shares of multinational media and entertainment corporation Paramount (NASDAQ:PARA) jumped 3.9% in the morning session after reports revealed that the newly-merged company is preparing a bid to acquire rival media conglomerate Warner Bros. Discovery.

headline: Warner-Paramount, Adobe, SK Hynix: Trending Stocks
summary: Superman, Harry Potter and Indiana Jones under one roof? Paramount Skydance (PSKY) is preparing a cash bid for Warner Bros Discovery (WBD), according to The Wall Street Journal. Adobe (ADBE) shares rose after better-than-expected results and Nvidia (NVDA) supplier SK Hynix (000660.KS) rose after announcing the development of its new high-bandwidth memory chip. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Larry Ellison is back on top, 48 years after he co-founded Oracle
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Fortune magazine wondered on its cover whether Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison might become the world's richest person, while BusinessWeek declared Ellison is "cool again," noting that "Silicon Valley's bad boy is having his revenge."  The octogenarian Ellison is back in headlines after Oracle announced a clutch of cloud computing deals that rocked the tech world and sent its stock up 35.9%, putting Ellison's fortune close to $400 billion, second globally only to Elon Musk.  Then on Thursday, news broke that Paramount, the media conglomerate Ellison's family now controls, is preparing a bid to buy out the storied Warner Bros Discovery, threatening overnight to dominate Hollywood and culture.

content.title: Larry Ellison is back on top, 48 years after he co-founded Oracle
content.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Fortune magazine wondered on its cover whether Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison might become the world's richest person, while BusinessWeek declared Ellison is "cool again," noting that "Silicon Valley's bad boy is having his revenge."  The octogenarian Ellison is back in headlines after Oracle announced a clutch of cloud computing deals that rocked the tech world and sent its stock up 35.9%, putting Ellison's fortune close to $400 billion, second globally only to Elon Musk.  Then on Thursday, news broke that Paramount, the media conglomerate Ellison's family now controls, is preparing a bid to buy out the storied Warner Bros Discovery, threatening overnight to dominate Hollywood and culture.
